alert.note: Alert for Coweta; Harris; Heard; Meriwether; Troup (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 3:01PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Meriwether, southeastern Heard, Troup, southwestern Coweta and north central Harris Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 301 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Mountville, or 8 miles west of Greenville, moving west at 15 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, up to penny sized hail and frequent cloud to ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... LaGrange, Franklin, Greenville, Hogansville, Grantville, Pine Mountain, Warm Springs, Lone Oak, Corinth, F.d. Roosevelt State Park, Saint Marks, Mountville, Louise, Odessadale, Stovall, Harrisonville, Hillcrest, Big Springs, Durand and Wares Crossroads. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for west central Georgia.
